title: Bold Words In String
description:
Given an array of keywords words and a string s, make all appearances of all keywords words[i] in s bold. Any letters between  and  tags become bold.
Return s after adding the bold tags. The returned string should use the least number of tags possible, and the tags should form a valid combination.
 
Example 1:

Input: words = ["ab","bc"], s = "aabcd"
Output: "aabcd"
Explanation: Note that returning "aabcd" would use more tags, so it is incorrect.

Example 2:

Input: words = ["ab","cb"], s = "aabcd"
Output: "aabcd"

 
Constraints:

1 <= s.length <= 500
0 <= words.length <= 50
1 <= words[i].length <= 10
s and words[i] consist of lowercase English letters.

 
Note: This question is the same as 616. Add Bold Tag in String.
starter_code:
class Solution:
    def boldWords(self, words: List[str], s: str) -> str:

test_cases: assert candidate(words = ['is', 'in'],s = "this is an interesting string") == "this is an interesting string"
assert candidate(words = ['test'],s = "this is a test string") == "this is a test string"
assert candidate(words = ['cat', 'dog'],s = "cat and dog are friends, but catdog is a special creature") == "cat and dog are friends, but catdog is a special creature"
assert candidate(words = ['test', 'testing'],s = "this is a test testing string") == "this is a test testing string"
assert candidate(words = ['is', 'island', 'sand'],s = "this is an island surrounded by sand") == "this is an island surrounded by sand"
assert candidate(words = ['is', 'in'],s = "this is an interesting situation") == "this is an interesting situation"
assert candidate(words = ['hello', 'world'],s = "hello world, hello universe") == "hello world, hello universe"
assert candidate(words = ['hello', 'world'],s = "hello world! hello universe") == "hello world! hello universe"
assert candidate(words = ['quick', 'brown', 'fox'],s = "the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog") == "the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog"
assert candidate(words = ['cat', 'bat'],s = "the cattle were battling the bat") == "the cattle were battling the bat"
assert candidate(words = ['substring', 'string'],s = "this is a substring string") == "this is a substring string"
assert candidate(words = ['word', 'world', 'wor'],s = "worldwide world of words") == "worldwide world of words"
assert candidate(words = ['hello', 'world'],s = "hello world! welcome to the hello world") == "hello world! welcome to the hello world"
assert candidate(words = ['jump', 'jumps', 'jumping'],s = "he was jumping over the jumps while he jump") == "he was jumping over the jumps while he jump"
assert candidate(words = ['overlap', 'lapping'],s = "overlapping strings can be tricky") == "overlapping strings can be tricky"
assert candidate(words = ['cat', 'dog'],s = "the cat and the dog went to the market") == "the cat and the dog went to the market"
assert candidate(words = ['this', 'that'],s = "this is a test, that should be bold, but this is not that") == "this is a test, that should be bold, but this is not that"
